title: zss configuration
description: Configuration properties for zss, as specified within a configuration file such as zowe.yaml

tls.description: Whether or not the server should run in HTTPS or HTTP mode

crossMemoryServerName.description: The nickname of the ZIS server that exists on the same LPAR as ZSS

agent.description: Configuration options specific to app-server agents, such as ZSS. These options are used to configure the agent, but also to tell app-server about the agent configuration

64bit.description: Whether or not to run zss in 64 bit or 31 bit mode

mediationLayer.description: Properties relating to how the app-server should interact with and find the API Mediation Layer components

isHttps.description: Controls if connections to the API Mediation Layer gateway and/or discovery service should be HTTP or HTTPS

gatewayHostname.description: The hostname or IP where the Zowe Gateway service is running. When not specified, the hostname property is used instead

hostname.description: The hostname or IP where the Zowe Discovery service is running

gatewayPort.description: The port where the Zowe Gateway service is running

port.description: The port where the Zowe Discovery service is running

enabled.description: is Gateway and Discovery service enabled

serviceName.description: What the agent will be named when found on the API Mediation Layer

enabled.description: Controls whether the agent should register to the API Mediation Layer, and whether the app-server should contact it via the Mediation Layer
Controls whether the app-server storage API can store in the caching service

https.description: Configures the agent to use HTTPS.

label.description: The label (aka alias), identifying the server's certificate in the key store

keyring.description: This misnamed property is ICSF key ring identifier as '<user>/<ringName>' or USS file path to a .p12 format cert file

http.description: Configures the agent to use HTTP. When using AT-TLS, this object should be defined but with http.attls=true. It is insecure and absolutely not recommended to use http without AT-TLS

attls.description: Tells the app-server whether or not the agent should be reached using HTTPS or HTTP when contacting the HTTP port

handshakeTimeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds on the startup check the app-server will do to find its agent and check agent capabilities

fallback.description: Whether the agent will issue and accept cookies from itself in the event a JWT cannot be provided

retryIntervalSeconds.description: The time in seconds to wait between attempts to reach the JWT provider in case they are inaccessible

pluginsDir.description: The location where plugin locator JSON files are found, which are used by the app-server and agent to locate and use plugins

instanceDir.description: The location where ZSS may store additional configuration files

productDir.description: The location where ZSS may read defaults for configuration files that would be overridden within instanceDir

dataserviceAuthentication.description: Describes how the app-server will utilize the auth plugins it finds and loads at startup

rbac.description: Determines whether or not the app-server will issue authorization requests to the authentication plugins for each HTTP(S) request to achieve Role Based Access Control

defaultAuthentication.description: Instructs the app-server which authentication category to issue auth requests to if a specific one was not specified by the caller or plugin

logLevels.description: Loggers here are either for builtin logs (_zss) or plugins. The dots (.) are literally part of the strings, and not another level in the configuration. For example, components.zss.logLevels['_zss.traceLevel']=5 is a logLevels object with a member zss.traceLevel

_zss.fileTrace.description: Logs file serving behavior (if file serving is enabled).

_zss.httpDispatchTrace.description: Logs dispatching of HTTP messages to dataservices.

_zss.httpHeadersTrace.description: Logs parsing and setting of HTTP headers.

_zss.httpSocketTrace.description: Logs TCP socket behavior for HTTP.

_zss.httpCloseConversationTrace.description: Logs HTTP behavior for when an HTTP conversation ends.

_zss.mvdserver.description: Generic logging for ZSS items not covered by other loggers

_zss.ctds.description: Controls logging of the built-in CTDS service

_zss.security.description: Controls logging of the built-in security service

_zss.unixfile.description: Controls logging of the built-in unixfile service

_zss.dataservice.description: Controls logging of generic dataservice tasks

_zss.apimlstorage.description: Controls logging of the dataservice storage API

_zss.jwk.description: Controls logging of JWK use for SSO

_zss.alloc.description: Controls logging of JWK use for SSO

_zss.utils.description: Controls logging of util library functions

_zss.collections.description: Controls logging of collection structure library functions

_zss.serialization.description: Controls logging of serialiation library functions

_zss.zlparser.description: Controls logging of zlparser library functions

_zss.zlcompiler.description: Controls logging of zlcompiler library functions

_zss.zlruntime.description: Controls logging of zlruntime library functions

_zss.stcbase.description: Controls logging of STC Base functions

_zss.httpserver.description: Controls logging of the http server base

_zss.cms.description: Controls logging of cms library functions

_zss.lpa.description: Controls logging of lpa library functions

_zss.restfile.description: Controls logging of the REST api for files

_zss.zos.description: Controls logging of zos utility library functions

_zss.httpclient.description: Controls logging of http client calls

_zss.jwt.description: Controls logging of JWT library functions

logLevel.description: Log level verbosity where 0 is least verbose (errors only), 5 is most verbose (trace) and 2 is default (info)
